tn.text: "Moses finished setting up the tabernacle"

tn.ref: the leaders of Israel ... the heads of their ancestor's families
tn.text: These two phrases describe the same group of people two different ways. AT: "the leaders of Israel who are also the heads of their ancestors families" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: the heads of their ancestor's families
tn.text: Here the leaders of the families are referred to as "heads." AT: "the leaders of their ancestor's families" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: had overseen the counting of the men
tn.text: The abstract noun "counting" can be stated as a verb. AT: "had helped Aaron and Moses to count the men" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: They brought their offerings before Yahweh ... They presented these things in front of the tabernacle
tn.text: This means that they gave their offerings to Yahweh and brought them to the tabernacle. These phrases may be combined to add clarity. AT: "They brought their offerings to Yahweh and presented them to him in front of the tabernacle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: six covered carts and twelve oxen
tn.text: "6 covered carts and 12 oxen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: to each one as his work needs them
tn.text: "to each man as he needs them for his work"
Translate these men's names the same way that you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:03:17|3:17]].

tn.ref: because of what their work needed
tn.text: "because it was what they needed to do their work"

tn.ref: in the care of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest
tn.text: "under the supervision of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest" or "Ithamar son of Aaron the priest oversaw their work"
Translate this man's name the same way that you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:03:01|1:2]].
The word "he" refers to Moses.

tn.ref: because of what their work required
tn.text: "because it was what they needed to do their work"
This refers to the carts and oxen.
Translate this man's name the same way that you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:03:17|3:17]].
"their work would be"

tn.ref: the things that belong to Yahweh
tn.text: You can make explicit the implicit meaning of what belongs to Yahweh. AT: "the things that Yahweh reserved for the tabernacle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"offered gifts"

tn.ref: Each leader must offer on his own day his sacrifice
tn.text: "Each day, one leader must offer his sacrifice"
"the 1st day" or "day 1" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])
These are the names of men. See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:num:01:07|1:7]]

If necessary, these weights can be written in modern measurements. AT: "one silver platter weighing nearly one and a half kilograms" or "one silver platter weighing one kilogram and 430 grams" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]])

tn.ref: one silver bowl weighing seventy shekels
tn.text: "one silver bowl weighing 70 shekels." If necessary, these weights can be written in modern measurements. AT: "one silver bowl weighing nearly eight tenths of a kilogram" or "one silver bowl weighting 770 grams" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: by the standard weight of the sanctuary shekel
tn.text: There were shekels of different weights. This is the one that people had to use in the sanctuary of the sacred tent. If you are converting the weights to modern measures, here is another way to translate this phrase. AT: "measured by the standard weights used in the sanctuary" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "fine flour that he had mixed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: one gold dish that weighed ten shekels
tn.text: If necessary, this can be written in modern measurements. AT: "one gold dish that weighed one tenth of a kilogram" or "one gold dish that weighed 110 grams"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]])
"that were each one year old"

tn.ref: This was the sacrifice of Nahshon son of Amminadab
tn.text: "This was what Nahshon son of Amminadab presented"
Translate this man's name the same way that you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:01:07|1:7]].
"the 2nd day" or "day 2" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_ordinal]])

tn.text: There were shekels of different weights. This is the one that people had to use in the sanctuary of the sacred tent. Translate this phrase the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:07:12|7:13]]. AT: "measured by the standard weights used in the sanctuary" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "fine flour that he had mixed with oil" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: one gold dish weighing ten shekels
tn.text: If necessary, this can be written in modern measurements. See how you translated these same weights in [[:en:bible:notes:num:07:12|7:14]]. AT: "one gold dish weighing one tenth of a kilogram" or "one gold dish weighting 110 grams" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]])
"that were each one year old"

tn.ref: This was the sacrifice of Ahira son of Enan
tn.text: "This was what Ahira son of Enan gave as a sacrifice"
Translate this man's name the same way that you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:01:12|1:15]].
The phrase "set apart" means to be dedicated to a specific purpose. In this case, the offerings were dedicated to Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: on the day that Moses anointed the altar
tn.text: Here the word "day" refers to a general period of time. The leaders of Israel dedicated these things over the course of 12 days. AT: "when Moses anointed the altar"

If necessary, these weights can be written in modern measurements. See how you translated this same weight in [[:en:bible:notes:num:07:12|7:13]]. AT: "each silver platter weighed nearly one and a half kilograms" or "each silver platter weighed one kilogram and 430 grams" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]])

"each bowl weighted 70 shekels." If necessary, these weight can be written in modern measurements. See how you translated this same weight in [[:en:bible:notes:num:07:12|7:13]]. AT: "each bowl weighed nearly eight tenths of a kilogram" or "each bowl weighed 770 grams" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: by the standard weight of the sanctuary shekel
tn.text: There were shekels of different weights. This is the one that people had to use in the sanctuary of the sacred tent. Translate this phrase the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:07:12|7:13]]. AT: "measured by the standard weights used in the sanctuary" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]])

tn.ref: All the silver vessels weighed ... All the gold dishes weighed
tn.text: "All the silver vessels together weighed  ... All the gold dishes together weighed"
This refers to all of the offerings that were made of silver, both the platters and the bowls.

tn.ref: Each of the twelve gold dishes ... weighed ten shekels
tn.text: "Each of the 12 gold dishes ... weighed 10 shekels." If necessary, this can be written in modern measurements. See how you translated these same weights in [[:en:bible:notes:num:07:12|7:14]]. AT: "Each of the 12 gold dishes ... weighed one tenth of a kilogram" or "Each of the 12 gold dishes ... weighed 110 grams" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
four ... sixty** - "12 ... 24 ... 60." These numbers may be written with numerals instead of with words. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"that were one year old"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "after Moses had anointed it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: he heard his voice speaking to him
tn.text: Here "his voice" refers to Yahweh. AT: "he heard Yahweh speaking to him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: from above the atonement lid ... from between the two cherubim
tn.text: These two phrases describe the same location. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
Translate this phrase in the same way that you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:04:05|4:5]].
"Yahweh spoke to Moses"
